literature_review:
Systematic Literature Review: test

Executive Summary

This automated literature review synthesizes findings from 1 papers on test. It includes per-paper summaries, a detailed methodology comparison, trends across years, identified research gaps, and actionable recommendations.

Key Findings

The analysis identified unspecified as the most frequently used methodology. Trends and yearly coverage indicate 1 years covered with peak activity in 2019.

Methodology Comparison

MethodologyCountPercentageAvg Relevance
unspecified1100.0%0.85

Per-paper Summaries

1. Machine Learning Testing: Survey, Landscapes and Horizons (2019)

Authors: Jie M. Zhang, Mark Harman, Lei Ma, Yang Liu

Abstract summary: This paper provides a comprehensive survey of Machine Learning Testing (ML testing) research. It covers 144 papers on testing properties (e.g., correctness, robustness, and fairness), testing components (e.g., the data, learning program, and framework), testing workflow (e.g., test generation and test evaluation), and application scenarios (e.g., autonomous driving, machine translation). The paper also analyses trends concerning datasets, research trends, and research focus, concluding with research challenges and promising research directions in ML testing.

View Paper

Research Gaps

  • Exploration of cross-disciplinary applications.
  • Need for standardized evaluation metrics.

Recommendations

  1. Incorporate real-world data for validation.
  2. Develop benchmarks for comparing different approaches.

References

  1. Jie M. Zhang, Mark Harman, Lei Ma, Yang Liu (2019). Machine Learning Testing: Survey, Landscapes and Horizons.

Conclusion

This review provides a synthesized snapshot of the state-of-the-art for test. Use the references and per-paper summaries to dive deeper into specific works.
